page.title: 08Population
page.content: The population of the Rural Area of Fareham in the 1920's was about eighteen thousand people.In 1930 the name was changed to the Urban District of Fareham and with the inclusion of several other villages this took the population up to about thirty thousand.With the exception of the Second World War years the population has steadily increased and now stands at about eightyfive thousand in the Borough of Fareham.The percentage of the population over fifty,like many other places,grows larger every year and in consequence much more building of sheltered accomodation is envisaged and indeed taking place.
